comments:
Not sure what cause this or what consequences are, but there is an exception in the logs (Mylar 2.0M3). Though I am running on a really really bad connection right now.

-- Error Log --
Date: Mon May 14 21:20:25 PDT 2007
Message: Could not download report
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar
Stack Trace:
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
at java.lang.String.<init>(String.java:208)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.convertHtml(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:268)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.updateTaskData(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:182)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.getTaskData(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:73)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.syncTask(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:134)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:87)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

I have added a safeguard but this should not happen anymore due to changes made as part of resolving bug 186897 . If the text contained only whitespaces these would be discarded and the HTML parser would returned -1. See HTML2TextReaderTest for an example.
